shows system processes which are used by Android OS

It analyzes your existing apps which use wakelock feature. And it shows which apps were holding wakelock for how much time and how many times. By seeing these statistics you will realize which apps were draining your battery
"This is not automatic memory freeing utility. It won't automatically kill apps running in background as some background services are necessary to be on background and should be killed manually."
"Wakelock is an Android OS feature for developers to control device's CPU life-cycle(awake asleep) and the screen state (on off dimmed)"

Sleep mode. It is when your CPU is in sleep mode(the lowest battery consumption mode). The device automatically goes into this mode if it is idle. That is why Apps have to use wakelocks to wake up the CPU and do some stuff like check for new message obtain GPS location alarming and etc..

"Wakelocks can be used to keep the CPU running prevent the screen from dimming prevent the screen from turning off. Those features add up much into battery consumption especially if unattained for longer period of time. It’s a good practice to use wakelocks only when strictly necessary for as short a time as needed and to release them as soon as possible. Usually 'Wakelock' management is left for programmer's preference but unfortunately not every programmers pays meticulous attention to manage its effects on battery consumption."

"CPU[Partial wakelocks] - this wakelock type can keep your CPU running while your phone's screen is off Screen wakelocks[Full wakelocks] - This can keep your screen from turning off(CPU will be also running)"

"Wakeup triggers are the apps which triggered phone to wakeup from deepsleep via AlarmManager of Android OS. Note that if you have problem with 'AlarmManager' then wakeup triggers helps you to detect which apps are registered to AlarmManager"

"[First] UnPlug your phone from charger. [Second] Leave your phone for at least 2-3 hours. It needs some time to gather data for analysis. [Third] Open the program You can see the apps which were holding wakelock. [Fourth] On top bar you can filter wakelocks by CPU or Screen. [Fifth] By default apps sorted by wakelock usage. Also you can sort them by Running State or Alphabetical order too"

"First Google that app as 'appname wakelock issue'. This will show you possible solutions. If not Check the settings of App(settings for frequency of events auto-updates data sync and so on). You can also Force stop the app as a temporaray solutionin settings. Otherwise uninstall and get alternative app"
"First Press to 'App info' in expanded view. Press 'Force stop' in app settings window it will stop app completely. 'Clean cache' 'Clean data' and finally 'Uninstall'"

Knowledge base is the collection of existing solutions for wakelock problems. You may find find description and solutions for common wakelock issues. However it is not guaranteed that you can find your solution in this database
